intro: Maba iturensis, commonly known as the Iturensis maba, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse ecological roles. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and produces small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
